ended.note: Presented recall on or shortly before

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on June 29, 1841, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on February 19, 1850, after confirmation. No record has been found of presentation of letter of recall or departure from post.

ended.note: Notified the Government of Denmark from Paris that he had relinquished charge on
Promoted to Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 9, 1890, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 18, 1897, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 12, 1907, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 17, 1931, after confirmation.
A commission of the same date as Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary to Denmark and Iceland was canceled.

Atherton left post on June 5, 1940. Atherton was still holding office as Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary to Denmark when he was recommissioned as such on July 8, 1943, in connection with additional appointments to Canada and Luxembourg.
The mission at Copenhagen was reopened as a Legation on June 16, 1945, with Davis in charge pending presentation of his letter of credence.

ended.note: Promoted to Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on August 3, 1989, after confirmation.

Nomination of February 25, 1856, withdrawn before the Senate acted upon it.

Not commissioned; nomination withdrawn before the Senate acted upon it.
